metadata.title: How to Choose YouTube Niche 2025: Selection Strategy Guide
metadata.description: Find your perfect YouTube niche. Selection criteria and market analysis for new creators.

hero.headline: How to Choose Your YouTube Niche
hero.subheadline: Find the intersection of passion, expertise, and opportunity.

sections.content: Your niche determines everything—audience, competition, monetization, and whether you'll still enjoy making content in 3 years. The perfect niche isn't just popular, it's sustainable for you personally. Here's how to choose wisely.

content.title: Passion/Interest
content.description: Can you make 500+ videos about this? Enthusiasm shows. Burnout kills channels.

content.title: Expertise/Credibility
content.description: What unique knowledge or perspective do you bring? Authority matters.

content.title: Market Demand
content.description: Are people searching for this content? Validate with keyword research.

sections.title: Niche Selection Process
content: List 10 topics you could talk about for hours
Research each: search volume, competition, monetization
Identify your unique angle in each
Eliminate overly saturated without clear differentiator
Analyze which resonates with audience AND you

content.title: Audience Size
content.description: Too small = limited growth. Too big = too much competition. Find sweet spot.

content.title: Monetization Potential
content.description: Some niches pay more (finance, tech). Consider sponsorship appeal.

content.title: Specificity
content.description: 'Gaming' is too broad. 'Retro Nintendo speedruns' is specific enough to own.

sections.title: Signs of Good Niche
content: You have unique perspective or expertise
Audience is engaged and willing to support

sections.title: Niche Validation Checklist
content: Passionate enough for years of content?

faq.question: Can I change my niche later?
faq.answer: Yes, but costly. Audience built for one topic may not follow. Better to pivot related than completely change. Choose carefully upfront.

faq.question: Should I choose profitable or passion?
faq.answer: Ideally both. Pure passion without demand means small audience. Pure profit without interest leads to burnout. Find overlap.

faq.question: How specific should my niche be?
faq.answer: Specific enough to be memorable and own a space. General enough to produce ongoing content. 'Guitar tutorials for beginners' better than just 'music.'

faq.question: What if my niche is saturated?
faq.answer: Find unique angle—different format, specific sub-niche, unique personality. Saturated means demand exists. Stand out, don't compete directly.
